title: Clinical-Centered Dental Treatment Education Design for Undergraduate Dental Students

context.prior_knowledge: Basic dental science theories and understanding of simple clinical procedures
context.additional_context: Intensive training program combining practical simulations and real clinical case analysis for in-service professionals

learning_goals: Learners can establish appropriate treatment plans for root canal therapy cases of varying complexity (minimum to intermediate).
Learners can apply standard clinical protocols (anesthesia, instrument use, medicament selection, etc.) for root canal treatment and retreatment with 90% accuracy.
Learners can perform informed consent documentation and difficulty assessment procedures in a simulated patient environment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
